page.title: 03ALL SAINTS PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The "village church" is{All Saints {Parish Church}and situated next to it is the 16th century Priests House. Today this is used for village activities and the rector, appointed in 1985, lives in a modern detached house. From our limited survey it would appear the church is not a focal point for the residents, many of whom do not go to any church. There is a moderate regular attendance with more on feast days. The church has a Sunday School and Mothers Union. Brownies, Guides, Cubs and Scouts attend services there. {Doddinghurst Methodist Church}was founded in 1972; the minister comes from Brentwood, and they also have visiting lay preachers. The services are held in All Saints Church by arrangement with the Anglicans. (CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE)
